PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Nesse projeto, temos por objetivo principal Desenvolver pesquisa em ensino sobre as Tecnologias Digitais da Informaзгo e da Comunicaзгo, na perspectiva da Educaзгo CTS, colaborando com a integraзгo desse campo de conhecimento no вmbito da formaзгo de professores e de seus formadores. Em sнntese, buscamos colocar a tecnologia como problema na Educaзгo CTS, ampliando a discussгo para as questхes epistemolуgicas, filosуficas e sociolуgicas que oportunizem um contraponto а utilizaзгo
meramente instrumental das Tecnologias Digitais da Informaзгo e Comunicaзгo (TDIC) nas prбticas
pedagуgicas. Como pano de fundo teуrico discutimos a tecnologia, seus sentidos e usos a partir da Teoria Crнtica da Tecnologia (TCT), de Andrew Feenberg (2012; 2003) e Бlvaro Vieira-Pinto (2005). Feenberg (2012) defende a ideia de que devemos transformar a tecnologia para que ela tenha os valores que queiramos que elas carreguem. Nessa acepзгo, nуs podemos controlar a tecnologia e nгo o contrбrio. Ou seja, rompemos com a visгo de que as tecnologias irгo transformar a educaзгo de modo automбtico e comeзamos a pensar como nуs, educadores, podemos transformб-las, para que elas atendam as nossas finalidades e se integre as nossas prбticas cotidianas de modo crнtico e criativo.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: CUESTIONES SOCIOTECNOLУGICAS EN LA FORMACIУN DE PROFESORES DE CIENCIAS: UNA PERSPECTIVA DISCURSIVA
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Technological partner in the training of science teachers issues: a

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this article we discussed socio-technological issues in science teacher?s education. The research uses Discourse Anaysis (DA) and Social Studies of Science and Technology (SSST) as theoretical and methodological references. For the analysis, we decided to focus the discussions carried out on a preliminary investigation process of the school reality and any possible social contradictions noted by teachers in continuum or initial education. This is how we related the discourse on technology, produced in the theoretical field, wich the discourse made by the teachers durign the meetings of study and class planning. We concluded that such discourses materialize social contradictions which could be considered socio-technological issues. Those issues are related with several scientific, political and economic factors that might be problematized by teachers and students in Science classes, displaying the relevance of Discursive Approach on Science, Technology and Society Education. Keywords:discourse; socio-technological; science class; STS education; teacher education

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: A TECNOLOGIA COMO PROBLEMA NA EDUCAЗГO CTS: ANБLISES DE UMA OFICINA DE LEITURA NA FORMAЗГO DE PROFESSORES DE CIКNCIAS
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: A TECNOLOGIA COMO PROBLEMA NA EDUCAЗГO CTS: ANБLISES DE UMA OFICINA DE LEITURA NA FORMAЗГO DE PROFESSORES DE CIКNCIAS

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: ESTUDOS DO DISCURSO E DA TECNOLOGIA: PERSPECTIVAS CRНTICAS PARA A EDUCAЗГO CIENTНFICA, TECNOLOGIA E SOCIEDADE
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Discourse and technology studies: critical perspectives for Science, Technology and Society Education

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
In this article, I promote a dialogue between Critical Theory of Technology, by Andrew
Feenberg and Dicourse Analysis, by Michel Pкcheux, aiming to problematize determinist,
instrumentalist and neutral interpretations which follow the debates about technological
knowledge field in Science, Technology and Society (STS) Education. In order to do so, I
seek, through an analysis of theoretical texts, to promote a dialogue between Andrew
Feenberg's and Michel Pкcheux's in order to problematize and displace the deterministic,
instrumentalist and neutral discourses that accompany the discussions on technology in
Scientific and Technological Education in the context of STS Education.I consider that the
proposed dialogue provides subsidies for the displacement production, not only of meanings,
but also of educative and technological practices which aim to form people for social and
working life. At the same time, the city metaphor, used by Feenberg, presents itself as a
transformation possibility in science and/or technology education, producing, in my
understanding, a rupture with the school-university model conceived in an industrial
perspective. Based on debates here engendered, it is possible to think about a transformative
education, in which the city metaphor, applied in educational scope, can introduce new
dynamics in the processes of science and/or technology teaching-learning, in high school,
technical or graduation level.
